info.description:
Core Information provides several methods to access transversal information and the global inventory.is an API restricted to Orange Business Services customers.

This API allows to retrieve the list of Customer Accounts, Location, Resources, Products and Services. 

### Internationalization
This API Provides data only in English
### Resources

- **accounts** :  Customer Accounts 
- **locations** :  Geographic place identified by a postal address where equipment are deployed.
- **servicePoints** : Installed offers / solutions.
- **configurationItems** : Equipments or supports installed based on Service Points.


- **doc** : Documentation of the API in Swagger format.
- **status** : Health of the API component.
- **version** : Version of the API component.

Copyright © OBS 2021. All Rights Reserved.


### Scopes

| Scope | Features |
| --- | --- |
| b2b:core-information| Full access of the API. |
| b2b:core-information:readonly | API limited to read actions |  

# Authentication
 
The authentication is based on OAuth 2.0 and and API Key provided by Orange Business Services for _'Machine2Machine'_ mode.
info.title: Core Information

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Customer Account is a key object for API for Business catalog.

tags.name: Locations
tags.description: A location represents a geographic place with a postal address. Normally, it is the premises where equipment are deployed or buildings/offices where employees work

tags.name: Service Points
tags.description: Retrieve information on Installed offers, solutions

tags.name: Configuration Items
tags.description: List of installed equipments such as Routers, Switches etc... and also Access Lines.

tags.name: Miscellaneous
tags.description: Functions for Tracking the status of the API, versioning and ability to download the Swagger

get.description: This method allows to list all Customer Accounts associated to the authenticated login.

parameters.name: X-API-KEY
parameters.description: The API Key required for using Orange Business Services API.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first element to retrieve. Zero is the first item of the collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to retrieve.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The field name to sort the result. Prefixing a field name with a "-" sign will indicate a descending order. 
*Example: /accounts?sort=-name*

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Allows to select attributes returned by the end-point. It is a list of attributes separated by a comma.
*Example: /accounts?fields=id,name*

parameters.name: displayLinks
parameters.description: Flag to be set to show related resources links

parameters.name: displayNulls
parameters.description: Flag to be set to show null valued parameters

X-Total-Count.description: Number of total items matching the request

X-Result-Count.description: Number of returned items matching the request.

get.description:
This method allows to count locations futher one or several attributes and matching criterias.

This feature is useful for building dashboards.

For example, the call `GET /locations/aggregate?groupBy=address.country`

will returns

`
{
   'DE': 5,
   'FR' : 10,
   'IT' : 2
}
`

The _groupBy_ Query Parameter supports several attributes ex:  ` GET /servicePoints/aggregate?groupBy=address.country,customer.id`

get.description:
This method returns Configuration Items (equipment/devices, etc..) matching criterias.

The configuration item can have the following status

- **INSTALLING**: The equipment/device installtion is in progress, it is not operational
- **OPERATIONAL**: The equipment/device is ready for the service and totally operational
- **TERMINATED**: The equipment/device has been disconnected.
- **CANCELLED**: The equipment/device was not installed due to an issue.
- **UNKNOWN**: At this stage it is not possible to determine an accurate status of the deployment.

get.description:
This method allows to count Access Lines items futher one or several attributes and matching criterias.

This feature is useful for building dashboards.

For example, the call `GET /accessLines/aggregate?groupBy=state`

will returns

`
{
   'INSTALLING': 5,
   'OPERATIONAL' : 10,
   'TERMINATED' : 2
}
`

The _groupBy_ Query Parameter supports several attributes ex:  ` GET /requests/aggregate?groupBy=status,offer.family`
The method retrieve all attributes of a Configuration Item.

get.description:
This method returns all Service Points matching criterias.


The configuration item can have the following status

- **INSTALLING**: The service installtion is in progress, it is not operational
- **OPERATIONAL**: The service is 'ready for the service' and totally operational
- **TERMINATED**: The service has been disconnected.
- **CANCELLED**: The installation of the service was cancelled due to an issue.
- **UNKNOWN**: At this stage it is not possible to determine an accurate status of the deployment of the service.

This method allows to count Service Points items futher one or several attributes and matching criterias.

This feature is useful for building dashboards.

For example, the call `GET /servicePoints/aggregate?groupBy=state`

will returns

`
{
   'INSTALLING': 5,
   'OPERATIONAL' : 10,
   'TERMINATED' : 2
}
`

The _groupBy_ Query Parameter supports several attributes ex:  ` GET /servicePoints/aggregate?groupBy=state,offer.family`

get.description: This method provides detailed information on the API (Version/patch...)

Provide the current version of the Swagger File.
The API key is not required for this end-point.
This method allows to provide the current status of the API.

status.description: Status of the API. 'ok' indicates that the API is available without problems. 'ko' indicates that the API is facing some issues.

version.description: Version of the API in the format Major, Minor and patch number.

status.description: Status of the API. 'ok' indicates that the API is available without problems. 'ko' indicates that the API is facing some issues.

version.description: Version of the API in the format Major, Minor and patch number.

get.description: Provide information on the login using the API.

id.description: Orange Single Identifier of an Offer

name.description: Name of the main Offer associatzed to the device

family.description: Family of the offer such as NETWORK, VOICE...

localCompany.description: Name of the local company. It is not the Customer Account.

formattedAddress.description: Complete address with street, postal code, city and country

openingHours.description: Free text for describing the Opening Hours

legalNumber.description: National number of the location such as SIRET for France.

createdAt.description: The date and time of the object's creation in Orange Business Services systems

updatedAt.description:
Date when the record was updated in the API. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_.

city.description: City or town of the address

state.description: Federated entity of the address (State, Canton, Province, Bundesland,etc)

country.description: Code of the country in the ISO-3166-1 alpha 2 norm.

region.description: Code of the Region for Europe, Asia, etc..

GeoCoding.description: Latitude and Longitude of the Location.

deprecated.description: Flag indicating if the API is deprecated

TimeZone.description: Information of the TimeZone of the location.
TimeZone.title: TimeZone

LocationLinks.description: HATEOAS links of the location. This allows to navigate between API.

payload.description: Body in case of POST or PUT, PATCH method.

CustomerLinks.description: HATEOAS links of the Customer. This allows to navigate between APIs.

VersionDetails.description: Detailed information on the API version.

major.description: Major number of the API version.

minor.description: Minor number of the API version.

patch.description: Patch number of the API version.

id.description: Orange Single Identifier of the Customer.

createdAt.description: The date and time of the object's creation in Orange Business Services systems

updatedAt.description: The date and time of the object's creation in Orange Business Services systems

customerReference.description: Reference of the Location set by the Customer.

id.description: Orange Single Identifier of a Configuration Item.

customerReference.description: Reference set by the Customer to identify the Configuration Item

state.description: Provisioning State of the Configuration Item.

community.description: Community/VPN where the Configuration Item is deployed.

serviceLevelManagement.description: Information on the Service Level Management. **This feature is only available for International Customers.**

code.description: Code of the Service Level Management.

coverage.description: Coverage of the Service Level Management.

id.description: Single Identifier of the owner of the Configuration Item.

name.description: Name of the owner of the Configuration Item.

managedBy.description: Information on the entity in charge of the management.

id.description: Single Identifier of the entity in charge of the Management.

name.description: Name of the entity in charge of the Management.

supportedBy.description: Entity that will provide the Support.

id.description: Single Identifier of the entity in charge of the support.

name.description: Name of the entity in charge of the support.

keyDates.description: Dates of the Configuration Item Lifecycle.

installedAt.description: Date when the device has been installed.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.

startedAt.description: Date when the device has been declared ready for service.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.

endOfSaleAt.description: Date when the brand will stop to sale the equipment.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.

endOfSupportAt.description: Date when the brand will stop to support the equipment.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.

role.description: Role of the Configuration Item. The Equipment or Access Line can be a main (Primary) or not (secondary) equipment, access line.

layer.description: Layer where the device is operating.

hardware.description: Information on the hardware of the equipment. Available only if the Configuration Item is a device.

chassis.description: Chassis Name of the Configuration Item.

serialNumber.description: Serial Number of the Configuration Item.

network.description: Information about Network solutions. Only available on Network Equipments.

ipAddress.description: Main IP Address of the Configuration Item.

line.description: Information on the Access Line. Available only for Network solutions.

phoneNumber.description: Phone Number of the Access Line.

bandwidth.description: Information on the Bandwidth of an Access Line. Available only on Access Lines.

isGuaranteed.description: Flag indicating that the bandwidth is guaranteed

createdAt.description: The date and time of the object's creation in Orange Business Services systems

updatedAt.description:
Date when the record was updated in the API. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_.

_link.description: HATEOAS links of the location. This allows to navigate between API.

id.description: Orange Single identifier of the Service Point

name.description: Name of the Service Point composed of the Reference of the location and the type of service.

category.description: Category of the Service Point specified by the Customer during the Ordering process.

criticality.description: Criticality of the Service Point specified by the Customer during the Ordering process.

keyDates.description: Key dates of the Lifecycle of the Service Point.

orderedAt.description: Date when the service has been ordered by the Customer.

startedAt.description: Date when the service has been installed and Ready for Service.

terminatedAt.description: Date when the service has been disconnected.

billingStartedAt.description: Date when the billing started for this service.

billingEndedAt.description: Date when the billing started for this service.

createdAt.description: The date and time of the object's creation in Orange Business Services systems

updatedAt.description:
Date when the record was updated in the API. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_.
